intro: Onobroma helenioides, commonly known as the Helen's candlewood, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its showy, lantern-shaped flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. Its leaves are typically palmate, with five to seven lobes, and it thrives in well-drained, sandy soils. Onobroma helenioides is often found in rocky habitats and is adapted to arid environments.
